Header: Moon, Kim to hold summit in Pyongyang
Content: President of the Republic of Korea (ROK) Moon Jae-in and top leader of the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (DPRK) Kim Jong Un will meet in Pyongyang on Sept. 18-20, the Blue House said Thursday. The decision was made after President Moon Jae-in’s special envoys visited Pyongyang Wednesday to arrange a third inter-Korean summit for this year and met with Kim, delivering Moon’s letter to the DPRK leader. The five-member special delegation, led by Chung Eui-yong, Moon’s top national security adviser, flew via the west air route over the inter-Korean sea border to the DPRK’s capital city earlier in the day.During the meeting, Kim has renewed his commitment to making the Korean Peninsula free of nuclear weapons and threats, according to the DPRK’s state-run media.To discuss protocol, security, communications and media coverage for the upcoming summit, the two sides agreed to hold a high-ranking working-level meeting early next week at the border village of Panmunjom.
